intro: Viguiera tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that resemble those of the heliotrope, hence its common name. Viguiera tucumanensis thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
